task.title: Create an Action for the Content Definition
task.shortdesc: Let us add a Create action for our ToDo content definition.

context.p: Perform the following steps to create an action for the content definition.

step.stepresult:
The Create Action is displayed. Create Action
Create Action

step.info: By default, the Extends from event content type value is selected.

step.cmd: Choose one of the following actions to model the content definition:

choices.choice: Constructor action - action to construct the entity type.
Static action - a type level action which is applicable for the content definition.
Inline action - is an action which provides an output as part of the invocation response.

step.cmd: Select the Language for implementing action from the drop-down list.

step.info: The description is mandatory in all the places for documentation purpose. The information provided in this field will generate documentation for the content definition action.

step.cmd: Click next to the Action Inputs to define the action inputs.
step.info:
The action inputs field are displayed. Action Inputs
Action Inputs

step.cmd: Enter the required details for the Action Inputs.
step.info: The required action inputs are Name, Type, and Description.

step.cmd: Click next to the Action Outputs to define the action output when the action is complete.
step.info:
The action outputs field are displayed. Action Outputs
Action Outputs

step.cmd: Enter the required details for the Action Outputs.
step.info: The required action outputs are Name, Type, and Description.

step.stepresult:
The content definition lists the created action. Created Content Definition Action
Created Content Definition Action

taskbody.example: In this example, we have created a Create action to perform an action on the task. Now, we can create GetAll, Delete, MarkAsCompleted, MarkAsPending, GetPending, GetCompleted and GetNotes actions to perform various operations on the tasks.
taskbody.postreq: Compile the Action for the Content Definition.
